help.name: Config
help.description: Config action is used to set the configuration properties from configuration files and to reload server or runtime configuration entries. Config action runs in security mode that means could be called locally as it is or remotely, if you'll provide admin credentials (user credentials used to connect to the AR System instance). Instead of clear text password could be also provided the obfuscated version. As is described in the second example, _Demo_ user and _1234_ password must be the values of `app.server.default.arsystem.user.name` and `app.server.default.arsystem.user.password` from `default.properties` configuration sector.
help.syntax: areasy -action config [-reload] [-property ConfigurationProperty] [-sector ConfigurationSector] [-value ConfigurationValue] [-values Value1 Value2 .. ValueN>]

option.description: Reloads configuration entries after they are changed and saved in th configuration sector(s)
Specifies the configuration sector that have to be changed
This is the option that indicates the property key that will be modified
The list of values that have to be associated to the specified property key
The new value of the specified property key. If are specified both options (-value and -values) the list of values will be consolidated

sample.description: Reloads server configuration for a local AREasy server
Reloads server configuration for a remote AREasy server instance
Sets the property key that specify what AR Server server is connected to the AREasy instance and than reloads/refreshes configuration properties from AREasy server instance
